captitalize_first_letter() returns character string with first character of each word capitalized and remaining characters either left alone or are forced to lower case.

Source: R/capitalize_first_letter.R
capitalize_first_letter.Rd

captitalize_first_letter() returns character string with first character of each word capitalized and remaining characters either left alone or are forced to lower case.

capitalize_first_letter(words = "", lower = FALSE)

Arguments

words

character string with one or more words in each element.
lower

logical indicating whether remaining characters will be forced to lower case.

Examples

library(stringi, quietly = TRUE)
capitalize_first_letter(words = c("a", "vector of words",
                                 "TO BE CAPITALIZED."))
#> [1] "A"                  "Vector Of Words"    "TO BE CAPITALIZED."
capitalize_first_letter(words = c("a", "vector of words",
                                 "TO BE CAPITALIZED."), lower = TRUE)
#> [1] "A"                  "Vector Of Words"    "To Be Capitalized."
